title.value: DiffPack: A Torsional Diffusion Model for Autoregressive Protein Side-Chain Packing
title.justification: This is the title of the paper.
title.quote: DiffPack: A Torsional Diffusion Model for Autoregressive Protein Side-Chain Packing

extractions.description: The paper introduces DiffPack, a torsional diffusion model for predicting protein side-chain conformations. The model is evaluated on CASP13 and CASP14 benchmarks, showing improvements over previous methods. Key features include autoregressive diffusion process and modeling in torsion space.

type.justification: The paper presents a new model and evaluates its performance on established benchmarks, therefore it's empirical.
type.quote: We evaluate our method on several benchmarks for protein side-chain packing and compare it with existing state-of-the-art methods.

name.justification: The paper focuses on protein side-chain packing, a crucial task in protein structure prediction.
name.quote: Accurately predicting the conformation of protein side-chains given their backbones is important for applications in protein structure prediction, design and protein-protein interactions.

name.justification: The paper focuses on protein side-chain packing, which falls under the broader domain of protein structure prediction.
name.quote: Accurately predicting the conformation of protein side-chains given their backbones is important for applications in protein structure prediction, design and protein-protein interactions.

name.justification: The paper refers to the model as \"DiffPack\".
name.quote: In this paper, we introduce DiffPack, a torsional diffusion model that models the exact degree of freedom in side-chain packing, the joint distribution of four torsional angles.

is_contributed.justification: The paper introduces DiffPack as a novel approach for predicting protein side-chain conformations.
is_contributed.quote: In this paper, we introduce DiffPack, a torsional diffusion model that models the exact degree of freedom in side-chain packing, the joint distribution of four torsional angles.

is_executed.justification: The paper provides details of DiffPack's implementation and experimental setup, indicating its execution.
is_executed.quote: We evaluate our method on several benchmarks for protein side-chain packing and compare it with existing state-of-the-art methods.

is_compared.justification: The paper compares DiffPack with other methods, showing its superior performance on CASP13 and CASP14 benchmarks.
is_compared.quote: We evaluate our method on several benchmarks for protein side-chain packing and compare it with existing state-of-the-art methods.

referenced_paper_title.justification: No referenced paper title for DiffPack was found.

name.justification: The paper refers to the model as \"AlphaFold2\".
name.quote: Additionally, we show the effectiveness of our method in enhancing side-chain predictions in the AlphaFold2 model.

is_contributed.justification: The paper utilizes AlphaFold2 for generating non-native backbones, not for contribution.
is_contributed.quote: In this regard, we extend DiffPack to accommodate non-native backbones generated from AlphaFold2 [32].

is_executed.justification: The authors use AlphaFold2 for generating non-native backbones for their experiments.
is_executed.quote: In this regard, we extend DiffPack to accommodate non-native backbones generated from AlphaFold2 [32].

is_compared.justification: The paper compares DiffPack's performance to AlphaFold2, a well-known protein structure prediction model.
is_compared.quote: Additionally, we show the effectiveness of our method in enhancing side-chain predictions in the AlphaFold2 model.

referenced_paper_title.value: Highly accurate protein structure prediction with alphafold
referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper cites the AlphaFold2 paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Highly accurate protein structure prediction with alphafold.
